description: London Underground will operate a Saturday service on Good Friday. Normal services will then operate on Easter Saturday and Sunday. On Easter Monday a Saturday service will operate. However due to engineering work the following services will be suspended

texts: Transport for London today announced details of London travel arrangements over the Easter weekend.
London Underground will operate a Saturday service on Good Friday. Normal services will then operate on Easter Saturday and Sunday. On Easter Monday a Saturday service will operate.
However due to engineering work the following services will be suspended over the Easter weekend.
Circle line There will be no service, due to engineering work at Sloane Square.

District line Services will be suspended between Earl's Court and Whitechapel due to track replacement work between South Kensington and Sloane Square. A replacement bus service will operate between South Kensington and Aldgate East, late night only.

Metropolitan line
On going refurbishment works at Wembley Park will mean no service between Harrow-on-the-Hill and Aldgate, replacement buses will operate between Harrow-on-the-Hill and Willesden Green.

Jubilee line
There will be no service between Neasden and Kingsbury, due to refurbishment works at Wembley Park. Replacement bus services will operate between Neasden and Kingsbury.

Waterloo & City line
There will be no service on Easter Saturday due to engineering work. The line is normally closed on Sundays and Bank holidays.

TheHammersmith & City line will operate an enhanced service between Barking and Hammersmith throughout the Easter weekend due to engineering works taking place at Sloane Square affecting the Circle and District lines.

The following stations will be closed on both Good Friday and Easter Monday: Borough, Cannon Street, Chancery Lane, Mornington Crescent, Shoreditch and Temple. Due to refurbishment works Dagenham Heathway and Bayswater will have no train service throughout the weekend but will be open for ticket sales and travel advice.

OnLondon Buses , a Saturday service will operate on Good Friday. However bus routes 311, 409, 500, 514, 515, 551, 610 and 614 will not run and bus routes 8W and 351 will operate a Sunday service. Bus route 477 will operate to a Public Holiday timetable. Link here for more Buses travel information and timetables.

For the rest of the holiday weekend, there will be normal services on Easter Saturday and Easter Sunday. On Easter Monday a Sunday service will operate. Mobility buses will operate a normal service on Friday but there will be no service on Easter Monday. Night buses will be operating normally throughout the Easter break.
A Saturday service will operate on Good Friday on theDocklands Light Railway and also on Easter Monday. Normal services will run on the Easter Saturday and Sunday.

Routes 1 and 2 onCroydon Tramlink will run a Saturday service on Good Friday. Normal services will operate on both Easter Saturday and Sunday. On Easter Monday a Sunday service will be in operation.  However due to remedial work, buses replace trams on route 3 (New Addington branch) calling at all intermediate tram stops. Link here for more Tram travel information and timetables.
AllRiver services will run a normal service throughout the weekend.
For 24-hour information on all London travel, please call020 7222 1234 or visit TfL's website.
